question: Claire has a flower bed that is 185 feet long. Claire wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Claire's flowers grow 5 inches wide so she needs to leave 7.75 feet between every plant. Claire already owns 23 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €14 at the store, how much money will Claire spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Claire's flower bed is 185 feet / 7.75 feet per plant = <<185/7.75=23>>23 plants needed.
Claire needs to buy 23 plants - 23 plants = <<23-23=0>>0 plants needed to purchase.
Claire will spend 0 plants * €14 = €<<0*14=12>>12.
#### 12
